The provided code chunk is part of a larger document implementing a camera fixture management system in Python. The `Fixture` class, inheriting from `NodePath` and `FSM`, handles camera placement, orientation, field-of-view settings, and state transitions. This specific chunk defines the initialization method and basic properties for each fixture, enabling precise positioning and configuration within a 3D environment.

```context
The code defines a `Fixture` class that initializes camera fixtures with specified positions, orientations (hpr), and field of view parameters. It includes methods for string representation, data serialization (`pack`), and ID management, fitting into a system managing multiple camera states through FSM.
```

class Fixture(NodePath, FSM):
    def __init__(self, id, parent, pos, hpr, fov):
        NodePath.__init__(self, 'cam-%s' % id)
        FSM.__init__(self, '%s-fsm' % self.getName())
        self.id = id
        self.lens = PerspectiveLens()
        self.lens.setFov(base.camLens.getFov())

        model = base.loader.loadModel('models/misc/camera', okMissing = True)
        model.reparentTo(self)

        self.reparentTo(parent)
        self.setPos(pos)
        self.setHpr(hpr)
        self.setFov(fov)
        self.setLightOff(100)
        self.hide()

        self.scaleIval = None
        self.recordingInProgress = False
        self.dirty = False

    def __str__(self):
        return 'Fixture(%d, \'%s\', %s, %s, %s)' % (self.id, self.state, self.getPos(), self.getHpr(), self.getFov())

    def pack(self):
        return 'Camera(%s, %s, %s)' % (self.getPos(), self.getHpr(), self.getFov())

    def setId(self, id):
        self.id = id
